# cs162-todo-app

## üìã MVP Requirements Checklist (Generated by Claude)

### Core Features

#### 1. Multiple Users & Authentication
- [ ] Users can register with username, email, and password
- [ ] Users can log in with username and password
- [ ] Users can log out
- [ ] Passwords are hashed (not stored in plain text)
- [ ] Sessions persist across page refreshes

#### 2. User Isolation
- [ ] Each user only sees their own todo lists
- [ ] Users cannot view other users' tasks
- [ ] Users cannot modify other users' tasks
- [ ] All API routes check user authorization

#### 3. Multiple Lists
- [ ] Users can create multiple todo lists
- [ ] Users can switch between different lists
- [ ] Users can delete lists
- [ ] Deleting a list removes all its tasks

#### 4. Hierarchical Tasks (3 Levels)
- [ ] Users can create top-level tasks (Level 1)
- [ ] Users can add subtasks to any task (Level 2)
- [ ] Users can add sub-subtasks (Level 3)
- [ ] System prevents adding Level 4 (depth limit enforced)
- [ ] Tasks display in a hierarchical structure

#### 5. Task Completion
- [ ] Users can mark tasks as complete
- [ ] Users can unmark completed tasks
- [ ] Completed tasks have visual indication (strikethrough, opacity, etc.)
- [ ] Completion status persists in database

#### 6. Collapse/Expand Functionality
- [ ] Tasks with subtasks show collapse/expand control
- [ ] Clicking collapse hides all subtasks
- [ ] Clicking expand shows all subtasks
- [ ] Collapsed state persists in database
- [ ] Visual indicator shows if task is collapsed/expanded

#### 7. Move Tasks Between Lists
- [ ] Users can move top-level tasks to different lists
- [ ] When moving a task, all its subtasks move with it
- [ ] UI provides way to select target list
- [ ] Moved tasks appear in the new list correctly

#### 8. Data Persistence
- [ ] All data saved to database (SQLite or other)
- [ ] Data persists after server restart
- [ ] Users can log out and back in without losing data
- [ ] Database properly stores user relationships

---

## üéØ Additional Features Checklist

### Task Management
- [ ] Users can edit task titles
- [ ] Users can add/edit task descriptions (optional but nice)
- [ ] Users can delete individual tasks
- [ ] Deleting a task removes all its subtasks
- [ ] Tasks maintain proper ordering

### User Interface
- [ ] Clean, functional design (doesn't need to be fancy)
- [ ] All buttons and controls are clearly labeled
- [ ] Error messages display when operations fail
- [ ] Loading states show during API calls
- [ ] Forms have proper validation

---

## üíª Code Quality Checklist

### Backend (Flask)
- [ ] Code is organized into logical files (models, routes, auth)
- [ ] All Python functions have docstring comments
- [ ] Database models are properly defined
- [ ] API routes return appropriate status codes
- [ ] Error handling for invalid requests
- [ ] Security: passwords hashed, routes protected
- [ ] No hardcoded secrets (use environment variables or config)

### Frontend (React)
- [ ] Components are properly organized
- [ ] Functions have comments explaining their purpose
- [ ] State management is clear and logical
- [ ] API calls handle errors gracefully
- [ ] No console errors when using the app
- [ ] Code is readable and follows conventions

### Database
- [ ] Proper relationships between tables (User ‚Üí Lists, Lists ‚Üí Todos, Todos ‚Üí Parent)
- [ ] Foreign keys properly set up
- [ ] Cascade deletes work correctly
- [ ] Database schema makes sense

---

## üìù Documentation Checklist

### README.md Must Include:
- [ ] Project title and description
- [ ] List of features implemented
- [ ] Tech stack (Flask, React, SQLite, etc.)
- [ ] Installation instructions for macOS
- [ ] Installation instructions for Windows
- [ ] Instructions to run the backend
- [ ] Instructions to run the frontend
- [ ] **Link to demo video** ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT
- [ ] Your name
- [ ] Course and semester information

### README Installation Format:
```markdown
## Installation

### Backend Setup (Flask)

**macOS/Linux:**
```bash
cd backend
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
python3 app.py
```

**Windows:**
```bash
cd backend
python3 -m venv venv
venv\Scripts\activate.bat
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
python3 app.py
```

### Frontend Setup (React)
```bash
cd frontend
npm install
npm start
```
```

### Code Comments
- [ ] Every function explains what it does
- [ ] Complex logic has inline comments
- [ ] API endpoints documented with expected inputs/outputs
- [ ] Database models explain field purposes

---

## üé• Demo Video Checklist

### Video Requirements
- [ ] **Length: 3-5 minutes** (not exceeding 5 minutes)
- [ ] **Publicly accessible** (Loom, YouTube unlisted, Google Drive, etc.)
- [ ] **Shows your face or has audio** explaining what you're doing
- [ ] **Link added to README.md**

### Demo Content - Must Show:

#### 1. Authentication (30 seconds)
- [ ] Register a new user account
- [ ] Log in with credentials
- [ ] (Optional) Show logout and login again

#### 2. List Management (30 seconds)
- [ ] Create a new list
- [ ] Create a second list
- [ ] Switch between lists
- [ ] (Optional) Delete a list

#### 3. Task Creation - All 3 Levels (45 seconds)
- [ ] Add a top-level task (Level 1)
- [ ] Add a subtask to that task (Level 2)
- [ ] Add a sub-subtask (Level 3)
- [ ] **Demonstrate that you cannot add Level 4** (try and show error/disabled button)

#### 4. Task Completion (20 seconds)
- [ ] Mark a task as complete (show checkbox/button)
- [ ] Show visual change (strikethrough, grayed out, etc.)
- [ ] Unmark task if possible

#### 5. Collapse/Expand (30 seconds)
- [ ] Click to collapse a task (hide subtasks)
- [ ] Click to expand a task (show subtasks)
- [ ] Show that collapsed state persists

#### 6. Move Task Between Lists (30 seconds)
- [ ] Select a top-level task
- [ ] Move it to a different list
- [ ] Show that subtasks moved with it

#### 7. Additional Features (30 seconds)
- [ ] Edit a task
- [ ] Delete a task
- [ ] Any other features you added

### Recording Tips
- [ ] Test your audio before recording
- [ ] Close unnecessary tabs/windows
- [ ] Practice once before final recording
- [ ] Don't worry about being perfect - mistakes are OK!
- [ ] Speak clearly and explain what you're clicking

### Recommended Tools
- **Loom** (https://loom.com) - Free for .edu emails, browser-based
- **OBS Studio** - Free desktop recording
- **Zoom** - Record while screen sharing
- **QuickTime** (Mac) - Built-in screen recording
- **Xbox Game Bar** (Windows) - Win+G to record

---

## üì¶ Submission Checklist

### Before Creating ZIP

#### Test Everything One Last Time
- [ ] Start with fresh database (delete `instance/todos.db`)
- [ ] Run backend - no errors
- [ ] Run frontend - no errors
- [ ] Register new user
- [ ] Test all features work
- [ ] Check for console errors (F12 in browser)

#### Files to Include
- [ ] `backend/` folder with:
  - [ ] `app.py`
  - [ ] `models.py`
  - [ ] `auth.py`
  - [ ] `routes.py`
  - [ ] `requirements.txt`
  - [ ] `.gitignore`
- [ ] `frontend/` folder with:
  - [ ] `src/` directory with all components
  - [ ] `public/` directory
  - [ ] `package.json`
  - [ ] `.gitignore`
- [ ] `README.md` ‚ö†Ô∏è **WITH DEMO VIDEO LINK**
- [ ] Any additional documentation files

#### Files to EXCLUDE (Very Important!)
- [ ] ‚ùå `backend/venv/` - Virtual environment folder
- [ ] ‚ùå `backend/instance/` - Database folder
- [ ] ‚ùå `backend/__pycache__/` - Python cache
- [ ] ‚ùå `backend/*.pyc` - Compiled Python files
- [ ] ‚ùå `frontend/node_modules/` - Node packages folder
- [ ] ‚ùå `frontend/build/` - Production build
- [ ] ‚ùå `.DS_Store` - Mac system files
- [ ] ‚ùå `*.db` - Database files with your test data

### Creating the ZIP File

#### Option 1: Command Line (Recommended)
```bash
# From project root directory
zip -r todo-app-submission.zip . \
  -x "*/node_modules/*" \
  -x "*/venv/*" \
  -x "*/__pycache__/*" \
  -x "*.pyc" \
  -x "*/instance/*" \
  -x "*.db" \
  -x "*/build/*" \
  -x ".DS_Store" \
  -x "*.sqlite"
```

#### Option 2: Manual
1. Create new folder `todo-app-submission`
2. Copy `backend/` (exclude venv, instance, __pycache__)
3. Copy `frontend/` (exclude node_modules, build)
4. Copy `README.md` and other docs
5. Compress the folder to ZIP

### Verify Your ZIP
- [ ] Extract ZIP to a NEW location
- [ ] Open README and check demo link works
- [ ] Follow installation instructions
- [ ] Backend starts without errors
- [ ] Frontend starts without errors
- [ ] App works correctly
- [ ] ZIP file size is reasonable (should be under 50MB without node_modules/venv)

---

### Critical Items (Don't Submit Without These!)
- [ ] ‚≠ê Demo video is recorded and accessible

- [ ] ‚≠ê Installation instructions are accurate

- [ ] Professional README formatting
- [ ] Additional features beyond MVP

- [ ] No errors in browser console
- [ ] Responsive design

### Submission Information
- [ ] Your name in README

## üéØ Grading Rubric Alignment

Make sure you've addressed these typical grading categories:

### Functionality (40-50%)
- [ ] All MVP features implemented
- [ ] Features work without bugs
- [ ] Edge cases handled (empty lists, max depth, etc.)

### Code Quality (20-30%)
- [ ] Clean, organized code
- [ ] Proper comments and documentation
- [ ] Good separation of concerns
- [ ] No unnecessary code duplication

### User Interface (10-15%)
- [ ] Functional and intuitive
- [ ] All features accessible
- [ ] Error messages shown when needed
- [ ] Visual hierarchy makes sense

### Documentation (10-15%)
- [ ] Clear README with all required sections
- [ ] Installation instructions work
- [ ] Demo video is complete
- [ ] Code is well-commented

### Installation (5-10%)
- [ ] Instructions are clear and accurate
- [ ] All dependencies listed
- [ ] Grader can run app following README

---

## üì§ Submission Day Checklist

### Morning Of:
1. [ ] Watch your demo video one more time
2. [ ] Test your ZIP file installation one final time
3. [ ] Double-check demo link is accessible
4. [ ] Read through README for typos

### Before Clicking Submit:
1. [ ] Correct assignment portal?
2. [ ] Correct file uploaded?
3. [ ] All required fields filled out?
4. [ ] Within file size limit?
5. [ ] Before deadline?

### After Submitting:
1. [ ] Take a screenshot of submission confirmation
2. [ ] Keep a backup copy of your ZIP
3. [ ] Save a copy of your demo video
4. [ ] Celebrate! üéâ

---

## ‚ùì Common Questions

**Q: Can I use a different database than SQLite?**
A: Yes! Just make sure your README explains how to set it up.

**Q: Do I need password recovery/forgot password?**
A: No, assignment says it's not required.

**Q: Can I style it better than basic?**
A: Yes! Extra polish is always good, but functionality > appearance.

**Q: Do I need to deploy it online?**
A: Not required, but bonus points if you do!
